question:
Consider a coin that comes up heads with probability $p$ and tails with probability $1-p$. We flip this coin (independently) and stop as soon as it comes up heads for the fifth time. Let $X$ be the random variable whose value is the total number of times we flip the coin. What is the expected value $E(X)$ of $X$?
$5/p$ $5p$ $1/p^{5}$ $p^{5}$
